sense.name: having political or social influence over something
sense.examples: That part of Europe is no longer under Russia's sway. His decisions were clearly under the sway of upper management. The coach holds a lot of sway with his team members.

sense.name: tilting or rocking side to side
sense.examples: The audience enjoyed the sway of the dancers' hips. The sway of the branches in the wind was a peaceful sound.
